title: Update Navbar to show Home, Dashboard, and Admin (admin-only) nav links

requirements.text: Update Navbar.tsx so that when a user is authenticated, the navbar displays navigation links for 'Home', 'Dashboard', and — visible only to users with isAdmin = true — 'Admin'. The 'Admin' link must be hidden from non-admin authenticated users and from unauthenticated visitors. All links must follow the existing Navy Blue (#0A1F44) and White theme: white text on the navy background, with a hover/active highlight consistent with the current navbar style.

quotes: show home, dashboard and admin for admin only button in navbar

acceptanceCriteria: When a non-authenticated user visits any page, the navbar shows no navigation links (Home, Dashboard, Admin).
When an authenticated non-admin user is logged in, the navbar shows 'Home' and 'Dashboard' links only; the 'Admin' link is not rendered.
When an authenticated admin user (isAdmin = true) is logged in, the navbar shows 'Home', 'Dashboard', and 'Admin' links.
'Home' navigates to '/', 'Dashboard' navigates to '/dashboard', and 'Admin' navigates to '/admin'.
All nav links use white text on the #0A1F44 navbar background, consistent with the existing Navy Blue/White theme.
The mobile hamburger menu also respects the same visibility rules for each nav link.
No other navbar behaviour (logo, login/logout button, sticky positioning) is changed.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
All styling must remain within the Navy Blue (#0A1F44) and White theme — do not introduce new accent colours.
nonGoals: Changing the admin route guard logic in AdminRoute.tsx or ProtectedRoute.tsx.
